data.title: James Marsden Movies and TV Shows
data.meta_description: Check out James Marsden full list of movies and tv shows. Find out everything about James Marsden latest movies and best tv shows.
data.text:
James Paul Marsden was born on September 18, 1973. He is an American actor, singer, and former model. Marsden started acting with small roles on TV shows like Saved by the Bell: The New Class (1993), Touched by an Angel (1995), and Party of Five (1995).

He became famous in the early 2000s playing Scott Summers/Cyclops in the X-Men movies (2000–2014). He also appeared in Superman Returns (2006). Some of his other movies from this time are The Notebook (2004) and 10th & Wolf (2006).

Marsden was in the movie Hairspray (2007), which was very successful and won many awards. He sang two songs in this movie, and the soundtrack went Platinum. He acted in other movies like Sex Drive (2008), The Box (2009), and Straw Dogs (2011). Marsden also starred in family movies like Enchanted (2007), Hop (2011), and Disenchanted (2022), and in other films like 27 Dresses (2008) and The Best of Me (2014). He played Tom Wachowski in Sonic the Hedgehog (2020) and its sequel in 2022.

In 2012, Marsden was in several independent films. He returned to TV with guest roles in Modern Family (2011) and played a supporting role in 30 Rock (2012–2013). In 2013, he portrayed President John F. Kennedy in The Butler and was in Anchorman 2. Marsden starred as Teddy Flood in the HBO series Westworld (2016–2022) and has been in the Netflix series Dead to Me since 2019. In 2020, he played Stu Redman in The Stand on Paramount+. He will also appear in the Netflix film Unfrosted: The Pop Tart Story.

We’ll explore some of his standout films and TV shows. This article offers a detailed list of James Marsden movies and TV shows, highlighting his broad range of acting skills and artistic contributions.

Who is James Marsden?

James Marsden, born on September 18, 1973, in Stillwater, Oklahoma, is an American actor known for his diverse roles in both movies and tv shows. Growing up in a family of academics, he moved to Los Angeles to pursue acting after attending Oklahoma State University.

James Marsden’s acting career took off after a chance meeting with Kirk Cameron and Candace Cameron Bure during a family vacation in Hawaii, leading him to move to Los Angeles. His early roles included the pilot episode of “The Nanny” and the Canadian series “Boogies Diner.” His visibility increased with his role in “Second Noah” and further grew after notable performances in “Disturbing Behavior” and as Glenn Foy in “Ally McBeal.” Marsden gained significant fame as Cyclops in the “X-Men” series and continued to impress with roles in “Superman Returns,” “Hairspray,” and “Enchanted.” His other major films include “27 Dresses” and “The Box.” Married to Lisa Linde from 2000 to 2011, they have two children, and he has another son from a later relationship.

James Marsden Movies and TV Shows

James Marsden is an actor who has been in many movies and TV shows. He began his career with TV roles on shows like “The Nanny” and “Ally McBeal,” where he showcased his singing abilities. Marsden gained significant recognition as Cyclops in the “X-Men” movie series. He has also appeared in popular films such as “The Notebook,” “Superman Returns,” and musicals like “Hairspray,” where he performed songs. Additionally, he starred in the romantic comedies “27 Dresses” and “Enchanted,” further displaying his singing talent.

James Marsden has been in many different types of movies and TV shows, showing his wide range of acting skills.

Here’s the list of James Marsden movies and tv shows.

1. X-Men Series (2000, 2003, 2006)

Summary: In this popular superhero franchise based on the Marvel comics, Marsden plays Scott Summers, also known as Cyclops, who is a mutant with the ability to emit powerful energy blasts from his eyes. He is a key member of the X-Men, a group of mutants fighting for peaceful coexistence with humans.

Role: Cyclops/Scott Summers

Success: The X-Men series was highly successful, both critically and commercially, helping to usher in a new era of superhero films.

2. The Notebook (2004)

Summary: This romantic drama, based on Nicholas Sparks’ novel, tells the story of a young couple who fall in love in the 1940s. Marsden plays Lon Hammond, Jr., the wealthy fiancé of the female lead, Allie, portrayed by Rachel McAdams.

Role: Lon Hammond Jr.

Success: “The Notebook” was a commercial hit and remains a favorite among romantic film enthusiasts.

3. Superman Returns (2006)

Summary: In this continuation of the Superman saga, Marsden plays Richard White, the nephew of Daily Planet editor-in-chief Perry White and the romantic interest of Lois Lane.

Role: Richard White

Success: The film received generally positive reviews and performed well at the box office.

4. Hairspray (2007)

Summary: A film adaptation of the Broadway musical, which is itself based on John Waters’ 1988 movie. Marsden plays Corny Collins, the charismatic host of a popular TV dance show in the 1960s.

Role: Corny Collins

Success: “Hairspray” was a critical and commercial success, praised for its vibrant performances and message of inclusion.

5. Enchanted (2007)

Summary: This fantasy musical film blends animated and live-action styles. Marsden plays Prince Edward, a charming yet somewhat clueless prince from an animated realm who follows his love to the real world of New York City.

Role: Prince Edward

Success: “Enchanted” was well-received for its creative storytelling and was a box office success.

6. 27 Dresses (2008)

Summary: In this romantic comedy, Marsden plays Kevin Doyle, a cynical wedding reporter who ends up falling for Katherine Heigl’s character, a woman who has been a bridesmaid 27 times.

Role: Kevin Doyle

Success: The film was a hit, particularly popular among fans of the genre for its humor and charm.

7. Ally McBeal (1997-2002)

Summary: A legal comedy-drama series featuring Marsden as Glenn Foy in its fifth season, a lawyer and love interest for the titular character.

Role: Glenn Foy

Success: “Ally McBeal” was well-received, known for its unique blend of surreal humor and legal drama.

8. 30 Rock (2012-2013)

Summary: A critically acclaimed satirical sitcom about a fictional sketch comedy show. Marsden plays Criss Chros, the boyfriend of the show’s protagonist, Liz Lemon.

Role: Criss Chros

Success: “30 Rock” won numerous awards during its run, with Marsden contributing to some of its later successes.

9. Westworld (2016-2022)

Summary: A science fiction series set in a technologically advanced, Western-themed amusement park populated by androids. Marsden plays Teddy Flood, an android with a tragic narrative.

Role: Teddy Flood

Success: “Westworld” has been praised for its complex storytelling and philosophical depth, and Marsden’s performance was well-received.

Conclusion

James Marsden has proven himself to be a remarkably versatile actor across a wide range of movies and TV shows. From his early days as Cyclops in the X-Men franchise to his romantic roles in The Notebook and 27 Dresses, and his performances in musicals like Hairspray and Enchanted, Marsden has shown his ability to adapt to various genres. His work on television, including significant roles in series like Ally McBeal, 30 Rock, and Westworld, also highlights his dynamic range and enduring appeal.

Throughout his career, Marsden has consistently entertained audiences with his charm and talent, making him a beloved figure in the entertainment industry. His ongoing projects suggest that he will continue to be a prominent and influential presence in both cinema and television.

James Marsden Movies and TV Shows – FAQs

What is James Marsden most famous for?

James Marsden is most famous for his role as Cyclops in the X-Men movie series and his appearances in popular films like The Notebook, Superman Returns, and Enchanted.

Was James Marsden in Modern Family?

Yes, James Marsden appeared in Modern Family. He guest-starred as Barry, Mitchell’s hot new neighbor, in the episode “Slow Down Your Neighbors.”

Are Jason Marsden and James Marsden related?

No, Jason Marsden and James Marsden are not related. Despite sharing a last name and both being actors, they come from different families.

Who played Barry in Modern Family?

James Marsden played the character Barry in Modern Family. He appeared as the attractive and charming neighbor in the show.

What was James Marsden’s first major movie role?

A: James Marsden’s first major movie role was as Scott Summers, also known as Cyclops, in the 2000 film “X-Men.”

Has James Marsden ever won any awards for his acting?

A: While James Marsden has not won any major acting awards, he has received critical acclaim for his performances in various films and TV shows.

What is James Marsden’s most iconic role?

A: James Marsden’s most iconic role is often considered to be his portrayal of Cyclops in the “X-Men” series, where he played the leader of the mutant superhero team.

Has James Marsden ever appeared in any Broadway productions?

Yes, James Marsden made his Broadway debut in 2002, starring in the revival of the musical “The Rocky Horror Show.”

What upcoming projects can we expect to see James Marsden in?

A: James Marsden has several upcoming projects, including the film “Sonic the Hedgehog 2,” where he will reprise his role as Tom Wachowski, and the TV series “The Second Wave,” where he will play a lead role.
